question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Let $a_n = 4n^3 + 6n^2 + 4n + 1.$  Find
\[a_8 + a_9 + a_{10} + \dots + a_{23}.\]

The sum is
$$ \sum_{n=8}^{23} (4n^3 + 6n^2 + 4n + 1) = \sum_{n=8}^{23} 4n^3 + \sum_{n=8}^{23} 6n^2 + \sum_{n=8}^{23} 4n + \sum_{n=8}^{23} 1. $$
The sum of the first $N$ cubes is
$$ \sum_{n=1}^N n^3 = \left( \frac{N(N+1)}{2} \right)^2. $$
Thus,
\begin{align*} \sum_{n=8}^{23} 4n^3 &= 4 \left( \sum_{n=1}^{23} n^3 - \sum_{n=1}^7 n^3 \right) \\ &= 4 \left( \left( \frac{23(24)}{2} \right)^2 - \left( \frac{7(8)}{2} \right)^2 \right) \\ &= 4 \left( (138)^2 - (28)^2 \right) \\ &= 4 (19044 - 784) = 4(18260) = 73040. \end{align*}
The sum of the first $N$ squares is
$$ \sum_{n=1}^N n^2 = \frac{N(N+1)(2N+1)}{6}. $$
Thus,
\begin{align*} \sum_{n=8}^{23} 6n^2 &= 6 \left( \sum_{n=1}^{23} n^2 - \sum_{n=1}^7 n^2 \right) \\ &= 6 \left( \frac{23(24)(47)}{6} - \frac{7(8)(15)}{6} \right) \\ &= 6 \left( 23(4)(47) - 7(4)(5) \right) \\ &= 6 \left( 4324 - 140 \right) \\ &= 6(4184) = 25104. \end{align*}
The sum of the first $N$ integers is
$$ \sum_{n=1}^N n = \frac{N(N+1)}{2}. $$
Thus,
\begin{align*} \sum_{n=8}^{23} 4n &= 4 \left( \sum_{n=1}^{23} n - \sum_{n=1}^7 n \right) \\ &= 4 \left( \frac{23(24)}{2} - \frac{7(8)}{2} \right) \\ &= 4 \left( 276 - 28 \right) \\ &= 4(248) = 992. \end{align*}
Finally,
$$ \sum_{n=8}^{23} 1 = 23 - 8 + 1 = 16. $$
Thus,
$$ a_8 + a_9 + \dots + a_{23} = 73040 + 25104 + 992 + 16 = 99152. $$

Final Answer: $\boxed{99152}$
